decks.notes: The main concept of this Golgari Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. With a focus on utilizing the graveyard for value, cards like Dredger's Insight and Bloodghast provide card advantage while Umbral Collar Zealot and Overlord of the Balemurk apply pressure on the opponent. The deck aims to control the board with early creature plays and then push for a quick victory with powerful threats like Badgermole Cub and Beifong's Bounty Hunters. Additionally, the deck features a mana base that supports its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize a mixture of artifact cards and control spells to dominate the battlefield. The deck focuses on slowing down your opponent's strategy with cards like Cryogen Relic and Perilous Snare, while also building up your own defenses with cards like Floodfarm Verge and United Battlefront. By controlling the pace of the game and disrupting your opponent's plans, you aim to outlast them and secure victory using cards like Thousand Moons Smithy and Pinnacle Starcage to generate card advantage and maintain board control.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in the early game. By utilizing cards like Marauding Mako, Duelist of the Mind, and Tiger-Seal, the deck aims to pressure the opponent quickly with evasive threats. Fear of Missing Out and Torch the Tower provide additional reach to finish off the opponent. Multiversal Passage helps fix mana and allow for explosive plays. Overall, the deck focuses on applying early pressure and maintaining tempo to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing creature synergies and buffing them with cards like Repulsive Mutation and Tyvar, the Pummeler. Innkeeper's Talent allows for a quicker tempo by providing extra mana and card draw. The deck aims to swarm the board with creatures like Badgermole Cub and Ouroboroid while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Mockingbird. The ramp provided by Llanowar Elves and Gene Pollinator allows the player to quickly play high-cost creatures like Jackal, Genius Geneticist. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Nature's Rhythm and Restless Vinestalk to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of creatures, lands, and enchantments to quickly generate mana and create a powerful board presence. By establishing a strong mana base with cards like Llanowar Elves and Floodfarm Verge, the deck can quickly ramp up to play big threats like Appa, Steadfast Guardian and Aang. Airbender Ascension and Gene Pollinator provide additional support for the deck's strategy, while Quantum Riddler and Aang, Swift Savior offer versatility and protection. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a flurry of powerful creatures and efficient mana generation.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy and resources while slowly building up card advantage. It uses cards like "Unable to Scream" and "Shoot the Sheriff" to remove threats, "Tinybones Joins Up" and "Grim Bauble" for card advantage, and "Entity Tracker" and "Boomerang Basics" to control the board. The deck also utilizes lands like "Gloomlake Verge" and "Watery Grave" to ensure smooth mana production. By maintaining control of the game and outvaluing the opponent, this deck aims to secure victory through patience and strategic play.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of artifact cards and removal spells. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing cards like Intimidation Tactics, Cryogen Relic, and Perilous Snare. Additionally, it features powerful cards like The Soul Stone and The Irencrag to generate advantage and control the board. The deck also utilizes a variety of lands to ensure mana consistency and flexibility. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around controlling the game and outlasting the opponent.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a strong board presence with efficient creatures and disruptive spells to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes powerful cards like Elspeth, Storm Slayer and Essence Channeler to provide additional value and card advantage. Bitter Triumph and Seam Rip help control the opponent's board while Case of the Uneaten Feast and Lunar Convocation provide additional aggression and card draw. Aunt May and Haliya, Guided by Light offer support and protection for the rest of the creatures, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle to secure victory.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy through various means such as removing their threats, drawing cards, and manipulating their resources. Key cards include Boomerang Basics for bouncing their permanents, Fear of Isolation for disrupting their hand, and Multiversal Passage for mana fixing. The deck also utilizes card advantage and graveyard interaction with Grim Bauble and Entity Tracker. By controlling the board and resources, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and dominate the late game.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with fast, aggressive plays using the UR color combination. The deck focuses on quickly casting powerful creatures and spells to control the board and deal damage to your opponent efficiently. Cards like Quantum Riddler and Stormchaser's Talent help you draw cards and keep up the pressure, while cards like Torch the Tower and Tiger-Seal provide removal and disruption. By being proactive and applying constant pressure, this deck aims to quickly defeat your opponent before they have a chance to set up their own game plan.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with low-cost creatures like Spyglass Siren and Deep-Cavern Bat, supported by disruptive spells like Essence Scatter and Tragic Trajectory. Enduring Curiosity and Multiversal Passage provide card advantage and mana fixing, while Cecil, Dark Knight and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares offer strong finishers. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, aggressive plays while maintaining control with removal and counter spells, ultimately leading to a swift victory.

This deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and creatures to disrupt your opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Unable to Scream, Shoot the Sheriff, and Nowhere to Run, you can slow down your opponent's development while building up your own resources. The Legend of Kuruk and Tinybones Joins Up provide additional value and card advantage, while Stormchaser's Talent and Entity Tracker help you maintain board presence. With a good balance of removal spells and card draw, this Dimir Control deck aims to outlast and outmaneuver your opponent until you secure victory.

Utilizing a mix of creatures and spells, this deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with Llanowar Elves and Breeding Pools to cast powerful combo pieces like Doc Aurlock and Gene Pollinator. The deck includes cards like Bramble Familiar and Aang, at the Crossroads to protect key pieces and maintain board presence. By leveraging cards like Multiversal Passage and Airbender Ascension, the deck can create overwhelming advantages in the mid to late game, ultimately culminating in the powerful finishers Appa, Steadfast Guardian and Aang, Swift Savior for a game-winning combo.

The deck focuses on quickly developing a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures. The main strategy is to play efficient creatures like Llanowar Elves and Molt Tender to ramp up mana and continually apply pressure. Cards like Day of Black Sun and Disruptive Stormbrood help control the opponent's board while Shared Roots and Esper Origins provide card advantage. The deck aims to establish board dominance early and maintain it throughout the game using a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck revolves around using cards that can easily mill cards from the deck, allowing for faster access to powerful Reanimator cards like Overlord of the Balemurk and Bringer of the Last Gift. The main goal is to quickly bring back high-cost creatures from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats. The deck also includes various support cards to help facilitate this strategy, such as the ability to manipulate graveyards and provide additional resources. Overall, the deck aims to set up a strong board presence quickly and efficiently through its Combo - Reanimator archetype.

The main idea of this Dimir Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures like Spyglass Siren and Floodpits Drowner, supported by removal spells like Stab and Tragic Trajectory. The deck also includes card draw and additional resources with Enduring Curiosity and Cecil, Dark Knight. By combining efficient creatures with disruption and card advantage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain control of the game through tempo plays and disruptive effects.
